com.samsung.openscp

Class Apdu

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.openscp.Apdu

  • public class Apdu
extends java.lang.Object
    Data model for encapsulating an APDU command, as defined by ISO/IEC 7816-4 standard.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Apdu(int cla, int ins, int p1, int p2, byte[] data)
      Apdu(int, int, int, int, byte[], int, boolean) wrapper for Le=0 and forceAddLe=false
      Apdu(int cla, int ins, int p1, int p2, byte[] data, int le)
      Apdu(int, int, int, int, byte[], int, boolean) wrapper for forceAddLe=false
      Apdu(int cla, int ins, int p1, int p2, byte[] data, int le, boolean forceAddLe)
      Creates a new command APDU from a list of parameters specified by the ISO/IEC 7816-4 standard.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte getCla()
      Returns the CLA of the APDU.
      byte[] getData()
      Returns the data payload of the APDU.
      byte getIns()
      Returns the INS of the APDU.
      int getLe()
      Returns the Le of the APDU.
      byte getP1()
      Returns the parameter P1 of the APDU.
      byte getP2()
      Returns the parameter P2 of the APDU.
      boolean isForceAddLe()
      Returns the flag if 0x00 Le should be added to encoded APDU or not

    • Constructor Detail

      • Apdu

        public Apdu(int cla,
            int ins,
            int p1,
            int p2,
            @Nullable
            byte[] data,
            int le,
            boolean forceAddLe)
        Creates a new command APDU from a list of parameters specified by the ISO/IEC 7816-4 standard.
        Parameters:
        cla - the instruction class
        ins - the instruction number
        p1 - the first instruction parameter byte
        p2 - the second instruction parameter byte
        data - the command data
        le - the length of expected data in the response
        forceAddLe - should 0x00 Le be forcibly added to the encoded APDU form or not
